events.message: The insured filed a claim after their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported collision.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the auto accident claim and contact the insured for further details.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining next steps for the vehicle damage assessment.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and witness statements to proceed with investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos and the official police report for the car accident.
Investigation into the collision circumstances and vehicle damage commenced based on the submitted evidence and reports.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and that the damages align with the reported accident scenario.
The insurer proposed a fair settlement amount to cover the repairs of the vehicle based on the damage assessment.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved for payout following acceptance of the settlement by the insured party.
Payment for the vehicle repair costs was issued promptly and confirmation sent to the insured.
The auto accident claim was closed after successful payment and resolution of the insured's vehicle damage issues.
The complete claim file was archived in the system for recordkeeping and future reference if needed.
